intro: Microcorys longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved microcorys, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Native to certain regions of Asia, it thrives in moist, temperate climates. The plant has a fibrous root system and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
